questions.question: What is your company name?
questions.description: Used throughout the framework to identify your company

questions.question: What is the name of the product or solution this framework covers?
questions.description: Primary product or solution being positioned

questions.question: Who is the document owner responsible for maintaining this framework?
questions.description: Person or team responsible for updates and approvals

questions.question: What is the current version of this framework?
questions.description: Version number for tracking changes

questions.question: When does this framework become effective?
questions.description: Date when the framework should be used

questions.question: Who approves this messaging framework?
questions.description: Person who gives final approval for the framework

questions.question: What industry or industries does your solution target?
questions.description: Primary industry focus for your messaging

questions.question: What company sizes are you targeting?
questions.description: Size range of target companies

questions.question: Who is the primary decision maker for your solution?
questions.placeholder: Chief Technology Officer, VP of Operations
questions.description: Key buyer persona for your messaging

questions.question: Who are the primary users of your solution?
questions.description: End users who will interact with your product

questions.question: What are the key drivers that motivate customers to buy?
questions.placeholder: Cost reduction, operational efficiency, competitive advantage
questions.description: Primary motivations that influence purchase decisions

questions.question: What are the top 3-5 problems your target customers currently experience?
questions.placeholder: List each problem on a new line
questions.description: Pain points that your solution addresses

questions.question: What is your positioning statement? (For [target customer] who [need], our [product] is a [category] that [benefit])
questions.placeholder: For mid-market retailers who struggle with inventory management, our SmartStock platform is an AI-powered inventory system that reduces stockouts by 40%
questions.description: Core positioning that differentiates you in the market

questions.question: What is your core value proposition in one sentence?
questions.placeholder: We help retailers reduce stockouts and increase profitability through AI-powered inventory optimization
questions.description: Primary benefit you deliver to customers

questions.question: What are your 3-4 key value pillars?
questions.description: Core value areas that support your proposition

questions.question: Map customer pain points to your product capabilities and messaging
questions.description: How you address each pain point and the benefit message

questions.question: What do customers typically use instead of your solution?
questions.description: Alternatives customers consider

questions.question: What are your top 3-5 key differentiators?
questions.description: What makes you unique and valuable

questions.question: What proof points support your claims? (customer results, awards, patents, etc.)
questions.description: Evidence that builds credibility

questions.question: What is your primary message that should be communicated everywhere?
questions.placeholder: The only AI-powered platform that reduces inventory costs by 30%
questions.description: Core message used across all channels

questions.question: What are your 3-5 supporting messages?
questions.placeholder: List each supporting message on a new line
questions.description: Additional key messages that reinforce the primary message

questions.question: What is your 30-second elevator pitch?
questions.placeholder: We're the AI-powered inventory platform that helps retailers reduce stockouts by 40% and increase profitability by 25% through predictive analytics and automated reordering.
questions.description: Concise pitch for quick introductions

questions.question: What are the key messages for executive audiences? (focus on business outcomes)
questions.description: Messages tailored for C-suite and executive buyers

questions.question: What are the key messages for operational users? (focus on daily benefits)
questions.placeholder: Ease of use, time savings, workflow improvements
questions.description: Messages for day-to-day users

questions.question: What are the key messages for technical audiences? (focus on capabilities)
questions.description: Messages for technical evaluators

questions.question: How often should this framework be reviewed?
questions.description: Schedule for reviewing and updating the framework

questions.question: Which communication channels should this framework apply to?
questions.description: Channels where messaging consistency is required
